executive_summary: Packaging machinery manufacturers create machinery used for wrapping, canning, bottling and labeling for several markets in the food and beverage sector. The industry also manufactures thermoform, blister and skin packaging machinery for pharmaceutical products and medical devices.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Consumers have increasingly shopped online for essential and discretionary purchases as internet-based commerce platforms become more accessible and familiar to consumers in many age ranges.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Uncertain Economic Conditions Have Tempered Investment
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Consumers grew uncertain as the pandemic spread and the economy was disrupted, leading them to purchase and use fewer goods. Consumption of consumer goods slowed down as buyers grew uncertain.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Manufactured products need packaging for delivery
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Manufactured products need packaging for delivery to retailers or consumers, increasing demand for new packaging machines and parts for existing machines, which accumulate more wear and tear.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Trade is especially sensitive to the US dollar value
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Foreign manufacturers, mainly German and Italian, benefit from strong brand reputations and lower operating costs, resulting in imports satisfying a significant portion of domestic demand.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Demand for imports and exports dropped in 2022
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Demand for imports and exports dropped in 2022 as high inflation and heightened economic uncertainty have shaken demand for downstream industries and discouraged spending on new packaging machines.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Managing Costs Continues to be a Challenge
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Operating costs have climbed as the industry's input costs have been volatile. The price of steel has especially fluctuated in the years following the pandemic and crude oil prices have made it challenging to afford shipping in materials.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: KEY MARKETS WILL PROVIDE SUSTAINED DEMAND
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Food and beverage, household goods and pharmaceutical products are protected from severely volatile demand as these are often considered essential.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: EXPORTS WILL REBOUND AS THE US DOLLAR DEPRECIATES
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The value of the US dollar is expected to fall as economic conditions improve more quickly elsewhere, making domestic machinery more affordable when compared with foreign machinery.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: A weakening US dollar will cause imports to stagnate and allow domestic manufacturers to reclaim local demand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Companies already reliant on imported machinery will continue importing, but a less valuable dollar will promote domestic sales.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Operating Costs Will Be Hit By Volatility
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: While steel prices will remain far above pre-pandemic levels, they're expected to slow over the next five years.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: INVESTMENT ACTIVITY WILL REMAIN IN MURKY WATERS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Corporate profit plays a key role in determining how willing downstream companies are to invest in new packaging machinery.
